name: DC or Marvel? Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these superheroes was created by Marvel?
questions.explanation:
Spider-Man.

	Spider-Man was created by Stan Lee and first appeared in comics in 1962. His real identity is Peter Parker, and has fought villains such as Green Goblin, Venom, and Scorpion. He got his powers by being bitten by a radioactive spider. The first live action "Spider-Man" movie was released in 2002.

questions.text: Which of these superheroes was created by DC?
questions.explanation:
Green Arrow.

	Green Arrow first made an appearance in 1941 and resembles Marvel's Hawkeye. His identity is Oliver Queen, and he became the owner of Queen Industries after the death of his parents. Green Arrow does not have any super powers, but gets the job done with his bow and arrows.

questions.text: Which of these superheroes was not created by Marvel?
questions.explanation:
Aquaman.

	Aquaman first made an appearance in 1941. His real name is Arthur Curry, and he has fought alongside the Justice League. Aquaman rules the underwater city of Atlantis and has many powers including super-strength and the ability to speak telepathically with sea life.

questions.text: Which of these superheroes was not created by DC?
questions.explanation:
Star Lord.

	Star Lord is a member of the Guardians of the Galaxy. His real identity is Peter Quill and his first comic appearance was in 1976. He has worked alongside characters such as Rocket Raccoon, Groot, and Nebula. Star Lord was born on Earth, but now he travels the galaxy fighting crime.

questions.text: Which of these organizations can be found in Marvel Comics?
questions.explanation:
S.H.I.E.L.D.

	S.H.I.E.L.D. stands for Strategic Homeland Intervention Enforcement and Logistics Division. It is an organization run by Nick Fury that keeps track of alien threats. In 2013, a TV show titled "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D." premiered that showed how the organization really worked, and brought back dead Agent Phil Coulson, who died in "The Avengers" movie in 2012.

questions.text: Which of the following is a DC villain?
questions.explanation:
Vandal Savage.

	Vandal Savage is an immortal super villain that influenced many world events and crimes throughout history. His first comic book appearance was in a "Green Lantern" comic book in 1943. Lex Luther once found evidence that Vandal Savage was the first cannibal on record.

questions.text: Which of the following is a Marvel villain?
questions.explanation:
Loki.

	Loki is the adopted brother of Thor from Asgard. Loki is the son of a frost giant, enemies of the Asgardians, but was taken in by Thor's father, Odin. His character is based on Norse Mythology. He first made an appearance in Marvel comics in 1949, and was a villain in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.text: Which of the following is the real identity of a DC character?
questions.explanation:
Barry Allen.

	Barry Allen is the second character to represent The Flash in DC comics. He first appeared in 1956 and has the power to run faster than the speed of light and travel through time. Barry once traveled back in time to save his mother from being killed by the Reverse Flash. This caused and event known as the Flashpoint Paradox that almost led to the end of the world.

questions.text: Which of the following is the identity of a Marvel character?
questions.explanation:
Steve Rogers.

	Steve Rogers is the secret identity of Captain America. Captain America was originally active during World War II, but was frozen in ice and woke up decades later. Steve Rogers got his powers by being injected by an experimental serum that was kept secret. Later others would attempt to replicate this serum, and many would fail. Bruce Banner became The Hulk after failed experiments to make the serum in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.text: Which of the following objects would not be found in the Marvel Universe?
questions.explanation:
Kryptonite.

	Kryptonite is a mineral produced only on Krypton. This mineral is Superman's only weakness. Normally Superman is indestructible, but contact with Kryptonite allows him to be hurt. Superman's identity is Clark Kent.
